member.summary: Adds diagonals. Show the TopLabel and BottomLabel.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizArrowClipping.Left
member.summary: Clip the shape, leaving only the part to the left of the edge.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizArrowClipping.Right
member.summary: Clip the shape, leaving only the part to the right of the edge.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeDirection
member.summary: Enumeration that specifies where the arrow head is drawed

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.ClusterMode
member.summary:
Mode used for handling clusters. If clusterrank is "local", a subgraph whose name begins with "cluster" is given special treatment. The subgraph is laid out separately, and then integrated as a unit into its parent graph, with a bounding rectangle drawn about it.
If the cluster has a label parameter, this label is displayed within the rectangle. Note also that there can be clusters within clusters. At present, the modes "global" and "none" appear to be identical, both turning off the special cluster processing. color

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.LabelLocation
member.summary: Top/bottom placement of graph and cluster labels.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.OutputMode
member.summary: Specify the order in which nodes and edges are drawn in concrete output.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.OutputMode.BreadthFirst
member.summary: The default BreadthFirst is the simplest, but when the graph layout does not avoid edge-node overlap, this mode will sometimes have edges drawn over nodes and sometimes on top of nodes.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.OutputMode.NodesFirst
member.summary: If the mode NodesFirst is chosen, all nodes are drawn first, followed by the edges. This guarantees an edge-node overlap will not be mistaken for an edge ending at a node.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.OutputMode.EdgesFirst
member.summary: Usually for aesthetic reasons, it may be desirable that all edges appear beneath nodes, even if the resulting drawing is ambiguous. This can be achieved by choosing EdgesFirst.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.PageDirection
member.summary:
These specify the 8 row or column major orders for traversing a rectangular array, the first character corresponding to the major order and the second to the minor order. Thus, for "BL", the major order is from bottom to top, and the minor order is from left to right.
This means the bottom row is traversed first, from left to right, then the next row up, from left to right, and so on, until the topmost row is traversed.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.RatioMode
member.summary: Aspect ratio (drawing height/drawing width) for the drawing.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.RatioMode.Fill
member.summary: Vertex positions are scaled, separately in both x and y, so that the final drawing exactly fills the specified size.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.RatioMode.Compress
member.summary: Dot attempts to compress the initial layout to fit in the given size. This achieves a tighter packing of nodes but reduces the balance and symmetry. This feature only works in dot.

member.name: F:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.RatioMode.Auto
member.summary: If ratio = "auto", the page attribute is set and the graph cannot be drawn on a single page, then size is set to an ``ideal'' value. In particular, the size in a given dimension will be the smallest integral multiple of the page size in that dimension which is at least half the current size. The two dimensions are then scaled independently to the new size. This feature only works in dot.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizAlgorithm

remarks.para: This algorithms "renders" the graph to the dot format. dot is an open source application for drawing graphs available at http://www.research.att.com/sw/tools/graphviz/.

Further output customization can be achieved by using visitors and events. The events are
The GraphViz .Net wrapping was found written by Leppied and can be found at http://www.codeproject.com/dotnet/dfamachine.asp
Event Description
WriteGraph Add graph and global customization code here.
WriteVertex Add vertex appearance customization code here.
WriteEdge Add edge appearance customization code here.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdge.IsDecorated
member.summary: If true, attach edge label to edge by a 2-segment polyline, underlining the label, then going to the closest point of spline.

member.summary: Specifies layers in which the edge is present.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdge.MinLength
member.summary: Minimum edge length (rank difference between head and tail).

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdge.Style
member.summary: Set style foredge. For cluster subgraph, if "filled", the cluster box's background is filled.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdge.ToolTip
member.summary: Tooltip annotation attached to the node or edge. This is used only if the object has a URL attribute.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdge.Weight
member.summary: Weight of edge. In dot, the heavier the weight, the shorter, straighter and more vertical the edge is.

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdge.GenerateDot(System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Converts a dictionary of parameters name-value to dot code.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.Url
member.summary: For the output format imap or cmap, if Url is defined, it is output as part of the extremity label of the edge.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.IsClipped
member.summary: If true, the extremity of an edge is clipped to the boundary of the extremity node; otherwise, the end of the edge goes to the center of the node, or the center of a port, if applicable.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.Label
member.summary: Text label to be placed near extremity of edge.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.ToolTip
member.summary: Tooltip annotation attached to the extremity of an edge. This is used only if the edge has a Url attribute.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.Logical
member.summary: Logical extremity of an edge. When compound is true, if Logical is defined and is the name of a cluster containing the real extremity, the edge is clipped to the boundary of the cluster.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.Same
member.summary: Edges with the same extremity and the same samehead value are aimed at the same point on the head.

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizEdgeExtremity.AddParameters(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Adds the parameters relative to the extremity

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.ToString
member.summary: Converts graph option to string. Uses ToDot

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.Url
member.summary:
Hyperlinks incorporated into device-dependent output.
At present, used in ps2, cmap, i*map and svg formats. For all these formats, URLs can be attached to nodes, edges and clusters. URL attributes can also be attached to the root graph in ps2, cmap and i*map formats. This serves as the base URL for relative URLs in the former, and as the default image map file in the latter. The active area for a node or cluster is its bounding box. For edges, the active areas are small circles where the edge contacts its head and tail nodes. These areas may overlap the related node, and the edge URL dominates. If the edge has a label, this will also be active. Finally, if the edge has a head or tail label, this will also be active. Note, however, that if the edge has a headURL attribute, it is this value that is used near the head node and on the head label, if defined. The similar restriction holds when tailURL is defined.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.BackgroundColor
member.summary: This color is used as the background for entire canvas.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.IsCentered
member.summary: If true, the drawing is centered in the output canvas.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.ClusterRank
member.summary: Mode used for handling clusters. If clusterrank is "local", a subgraph whose name begins with "cluster" is given special treatment. The subgraph is laid out separately, and then integrated as a unit into its parent graph, with a bounding rectangle drawn about it. If the cluster has a label parameter, this label is displayed within the rectangle. Note also that there can be clusters within clusters. At present, the modes "global" and "none" appear to be identical, both turning off the special cluster processing.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.Comment
member.summary: Comments are inserted into output. Device-dependent

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.IsCompounded
member.summary: If true, allow edges between clusters. See lhead and ltail

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.LabelJustification
member.summary:
Justification for cluster labels. If "r", the label is right-justified within bounding rectangle; if "l", left-justified; else the label is centered. Note that a subgraph inherits attributes from its parent.
Thus, if the root graph sets labeljust to "l", the subgraph inherits this value.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.LabelLocation
member.summary:
Top/bottom placement of graph and cluster labels.
If the attribute is "t", place label at the top; if the attribute is "b", place label at the bottom. By default, root graph labels go on the bottom and cluster labels go on the top.
Note that a subgraph inherits attributes from its parent. Thus, if the root graph sets labelloc to "b", the subgraph inherits this value.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.McLimit
member.summary:
Multiplicative scale factor used to alter the MinQuit (default = 8) and MaxIter (default = 24) parameters used during crossing minimization.
These correspond to the number of tries without improvement before quitting and the maximum number of iterations in each pass.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.NodeSeparation
member.summary: Minimum space between two adjacent nodes in the same rank, in inches.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.IsNormalized
member.summary: If set, normalize coordinates of final layout so that the first point is at the origin, and then rotate the layout so that the first edge is horizontal.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.NsLimit
member.summary: Used to set number of iterations in network simplex applications. nslimit is used in computing node x coordinates, nslimit1 for ranking nodes. If defined, # iterations = nslimit(1) * # nodes; otherwise, # iterations = MAXINT.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.NsLimit1
member.summary: Used to set number of iterations in network simplex applications. nslimit is used in computing node x coordinates, nslimit1 for ranking nodes. If defined, # iterations = nslimit(1) * # nodes; otherwise, # iterations = MAXINT.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.OutputOrder
member.summary: Specify order in which nodes and edges are drawn.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.PageSize
member.summary:
Width and height of output pages, in inches. If this is set and is smaller than the size of the layout, a rectangular array of pages of the specified page size is overlaid on the layout, with origins aligned in the lower-left corner, thereby partitioning the layout into pages.
The pages are then produced one at a time, in pagedir order.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.PageDirection
member.summary: If the page attribute is set and applicable, this attribute specifies the order in which the pages are emitted. This is limited to one of the 8 row or column major orders.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.Quantum
member.summary: If quantum > 0.0, node label dimensions will be rounded to integral multiples of the quantum.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.RankSeparation
member.summary:
In dot, this the gives desired rank separation, in inches.
This is the minimum vertical distance between the bottom of the nodes in one rank and the tops of nodes in the next. If the value contains "equally", the centers of all ranks are spaced equally apart.
Note that both settings are possible, e.g., ranksep = "1.2 equally".

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.IsReMinCross
member.summary: If true and there are multiple clusters, run cross minimization a second time.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.Resolution
member.summary:
This specifies the expected number of pixels per inch on a display.
It is used to guarantee that dimensions in the output correspond to the correct number of points or inches

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.Rotate
member.summary: Canvas roation in degrees. If 90, set drawing orientation to landscape.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.SamplePoints
member.summary: Tthis give the number of points used to represent circles and ellipses.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.SearchSize
member.summary: During network simplex, maximum number of edges with negative cut values to search when looking for one with minimum cut value.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.Size
member.summary: Maximum width and height of drawing, inches. If defined and the drawing is too large, the drawing is uniformly scaled down so that it fits within the given size. Note that there is some interaction between the size and ratio attributes.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizGraph.StyleSheet
member.summary: A URL or pathname specifying an XML style sheet, used in SVG output.

member.name: T:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex
member.summary: A helper class for customizing Graphviz vertex appearance.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.FixedSize
member.summary: If set to true, the vertex size is fixed to Size.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Size
member.summary: Vertex size (enabled if FixedSize is true).

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Regular
member.summary: If true, force polygon to be regular.

summary.para: Hyperlinks incorporated into device-dependent output. At present, used in ps2, cmap, i*map and svg formats. For all these formats, URLs can be attached to nodes, edges and clusters.
URL attributes can also be attached to the root graph in ps2, cmap and i*map formats. This serves as the base URL for relative URLs in the former, and as the default image map file in the latter.

The active area for a node or cluster is its bounding box. For edges, the active areas are small circles where the edge contacts its head and tail nodes. These areas may overlap the related node, and the edge URL dominates. If the edge has a label, this will also be active.

Finally, if the edge has a head or tail label, this will also be active. Note, however, that if the edge has a headURL attribute, it is this value that is used near the head node and on the head label, if defined. The similar restriction holds when tailURL is defined.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.ToolTip
member.summary: Tooltip annotation attached to the node or edge. This is used only if the object has a URL attribute.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.StrokeColor
member.summary: Basic drawing color for graphics. Ignored if color = Color.Transparent

summary.para: Color used to fill the background of a node or cluster.

If fillcolor is not defined, color is used. (For clusters, if color is not defined, bgcolor is used.) If this is not defined, the default is used, except for shape=point or when the output format is MIF, which use black by default. Note that a cluster inherits the root graph's attributes if defined. Thus, if the root graph has defined a fillcolor, this will override a color or bgcolor attribute set for the cluster.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Comment
member.summary: Comments are inserted into output. Device-dependent

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Group
member.summary: If the end points of an edge belong to the same group, i.e., have the same group attribute, parameters are set to avoid crossings and keep the edges straight.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Layer
member.summary: Specifies layers in which the node or edge is present.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Orientation
member.summary: Angle, in degrees, used to rotate node shapes.

summary.para: Set number of peripheries used in polygonal shapes and cluster boundaries.
Default peripheries value is 1 and the user-defined shape will be drawn in a bounding rectangle. Setting peripheries=0 will turn this off.
Also, 1 is the maximum peripheries value for clusters.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Z
member.summary: Provides z coordinate for the node when output format is VRML.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Skew
member.summary: Skew factor for shape=polygon. Positive values skew top of polygon to right; negative to left.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.Distorsion
P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.TopLabel
member.summary: Additional label near top of nodes of shape M*.

member.name: P:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.BottomLabel
member.summary: Additional label near bottom of nodes of shape M*.

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.ToDot
member.summary: Generates dot code that represents the vertex appearance settings.

member.name: M:QuickGraph.Algorithms.Graphviz.GraphvizVertex.GenerateDot(System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Converts a dictionary of parameters name-value to dot code.
